website_summaries.verdict: If you don't mind the high price, the Kindle Oasis is the best e-reader you can buy today.
pros: The Kindle Oasis is the lightest Kindle yet at 4.6 ounces and is 3.4 mm at its thinnest point
A slim leather battery case is included and adheres magnetically to the device, bumping battery life up to a  9 weeks without WiFi on
The integrated light has been improved and you can turn pages by touching the screen or using the physical page-turn buttons
cons: It's pricey, isn't any zippier than the Voyage or Paperwhite, and isn't waterproof

customer_reviews.title: Incredible!
customer_reviews.text: Don't know how Amazon does it but this exceeded my expectations! Thought the Voyage was the ultimate E-reader, but the Oasis is smaller, lighter and has better contrast! We've owned them all since the original and the Oasis is just the best. With the EZhold strap, one finger reading is here!
customer_reviews.author: Robert S. Cope

customer_reviews.title: Conflicted...
customer_reviews.text: Let's start with the good. I love the concept, design and engineering. Light and easy to hold. Hard buttons that remap when you rotate the device. Secondary battery in the removable cover. Your choice on using the device with or without the cover. Quality issues abound. Like last year's Voyage, it takes several tries to get a decent unit. LED lights clearly causing cones of light and dark shadows. Color gradient from left to right. My third unit is decent but not perfect. I don't understand why $300 for an e-ink reader can't buy perfection.
customer_reviews.author: IT Guy

customer_reviews.title: Good, but...
customer_reviews.text: I like the Oasis, but I think I may like the Voyage better. The Oasis is smaller, and if Kindles keep getting smaller, they're going to be too small. The Oasis isn't that much larger than my iPhone. Love that the cover charges and helps keep the Oasis charged longer, but the part that covers the screen of the Oasis is significantly less sturdy than the origami cover for the Voyage. I also miss the cover having a stand to hold the kindle upright on a desk, table, lapdesk, etc. When reading for a long time, holding the Oasis gets a bit tough on the hands.
customer_reviews.author: Teri Robert

customer_reviews.title: It is very nice to hold in the hands
customer_reviews.text: Just got my Kindle Oasis today. It is very nice to hold in the hands, and without the cover, it is almost unnoticeable. I especially like the buttons that allow you to turn the page without moving your fingers to the screen. As for how to configure the buttons, the analog in me much prefers the "reverse" option where the bottom button moves to the next page. The screen is remarkably clear and appears to lack much of that "bluish" color that plagued my first generation Kindle Paperwhite and hurt my eyes during nighttime reading. I like the Oasis-Voyage-only Bookerly font too. Yes, the Oasis is expensive but I think it is a great product for serious readers.
customer_reviews.author: jjmann3

customer_reviews.title: Way too many problems
customer_reviews.text: I have had two of these in the past 30 days. Amazon sent a replacement as the charging cover wasnt charging the kindle. The same problem exists on the replacement - but many more. Requires charging every two days (and I never use the backlight). Worse, every hour or so the screen flickers, the menu appears, and the screen freezes, requiring restarting in order to be able to turn the page I see similar complaints in the reviews. Dont know if I will bother returning this for a third one that will also likely not work. Maybe Amazon should make these somewhere other than China.
customer_reviews.author: Steve s

customer_reviews.title: New Kindle Not So new
customer_reviews.text: The charging cover never worked. It wouldn't hold a charge. There were multiple problems. It had to be updated manually because the software was outdated. The new non-working cover was being replace by a refurbished cover. I returned it because of all the problems and bought a Voyager. I will never buy another Oasis!
customer_reviews.author: Luanne Serrato

customer_reviews.title: Charging issues
customer_reviews.text: I've 'had to charge this device 3 times since receiving it a week ago. I'm planning to return it. I was away from home and contacted Amazon by email. The suggestion was to do a hard reset because unit was non-responsive. It was responding...it told me to charge. both battery and cover needed recharge. I should add that I am not new to Amazon. I've had Kindle devices since the very first that was produced.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than the Voyage
customer_reviews.text: I like this better than the Voyage that this replaced. When using without the battery cover this Kindle is hilariously small and lightweight. The offset form factor is great because it gives you a nice place to hold that is outside the reading area. It's a bit expensive, considering the screen is realistically no better than the model it replaces. Battery life and form factor was worth it to me.
customer_reviews.author: S. Adkins

customer_reviews.title: Battery life not good
customer_reviews.text: They claimed that this Kindle had great battery power. I'm not sure if I am not doing something right, but my battery runs down very fast.I had it charged at 100% and I did not use it until the next day and the battery was already discharged from the kindle and the cover. I charged it again, then changed it to airplane mode and reduced the brightness of the screen. It only lasted 2 days and then the battery was totally discharged. The claims for the battery life are not true, unless I have purchased a defective product.
customer_reviews.author: Linda R. Baker

customer_reviews.title: On mine, there may be a slight touchscreen calibration issue
customer_reviews.text: Mostly I love it. Turning pages with real buttons is something I didn't even realized I missed. My only complaint is related to the touchscreen, which doesn't always respond as expected, although I suspect it might be mostly a matter of calibration. I touch a particular word, or a specific place on the screen, and the Kindle seems to think I'm touching a slightly different spot. This is most notable when I press the upper right corner to create a bookmark. Touching the extreme corner (which always worked perfectly on previous Kindles) results in nothing at all happening, but I have learned that carefully aiming for a spot about a quarter inch below the corner usually produces the desired result.
customer_reviews.author: Buz Kindling

customer_reviews.title: Defective Kindle Oasis
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived in good working condition. After 3 days of very light use, it started locking up. Power cycle was needed to return to working order. Eventually, page advance buttons stopped working as well. To expensive to have these problems almost straight out of the box. Returned for full refund. I will stick with my Paper White reader - very reliable ! I would not recommend this reader to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is the WORST
customer_reviews.text: At first I really loved this e-reader but coming from the paper white, I don't think it's worth the price AT ALL. the battery SUCKS!! Do not buy this unless you're ok with having to charge it frequently/ almost every night when in use. The paper white battery will last months when not in regular use but this one barely lasts 3 weeks when not in use. Very disappointed with the battery life. It does charge quickly but the inconvenience of needing to charge it all the time really kills it for me. I rather just use my paper white. I can't imagine how well this thing would do on a long flight.
customer_reviews.author: Stefany T

customer_reviews.title: Flat out doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Screen sensitivity is sub oar. Tool bar stays open, screen freezes, bookmark pops out for no reason. Could get through three pages eithout having to restart. What an expensive hunk of junk. Furthermore, I see hundreds have had the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: "Months" of battery life False Promise
customer_reviews.text: I bought this new high-priced Kindle because it promised "months" of battery life. After a week of use, I started getting messages that the cover was nearly out of power and to plug in and recharge. This was despite the fact that the unit itself seemed to be about 80%. Well, it wasn't long before the whole Kindle shut down after giving me several notices that the battery was very low. My previous Kindle lasted weeks but this new one only a week.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Hegranes

customer_reviews.title: Just Something Not Right
customer_reviews.text: The Oasis functions well as advertised, except that the battery life is no different from my earlier Kindles. In the end, however, something is not right about this Kindle. This the first Kindle that I use less that the earlier Voyage model. Somehow, the square shape is off-putting in my hand, or something is not the same, and I definitely miss the origami cover with a built-in stand. The end result is that I read far less with this Kindle, and I am switching back to my old Voyage.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Eagle

customer_reviews.title: I am disappointed
customer_reviews.text: It does not hold a charge like the Paperwhite I have. I have to charge it every other night. It is slow to change pages. It is slow to upload. I have taken the cover off numerous times and put it back on to make certain that I have a good connection. I love the smaller size, but I'm about ready to go back to my last Kindle! This one is very frustrating to me. I started with the Kindle the size of the iPad years ago and loved it. Then I bought the first small one and loved it. As they kept improving the Kindle, I kept buying the latest. This one is a disappointment and cost the most!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sassy

customer_reviews.title: Could be happier!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 5th Kindle, and I just gave one to my sister - so, I really am a Kindle fan. I really wanted to love the Oasis - longer battery life, adjustable light, smaller, lighter - but .... the battery is not impressing me. I get a few days reading, but nothing like my husband raves about. Yes, it is small, but with the charging leather case it is sharp on the edges. I can't hold it for long reading times without my fingers being sore. I would just like a softer feel - you know, like the leather case on the cellphone I am holding right now. Anyway, I remain a Kindle fan, but I could be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Coventry

customer_reviews.title: Love it, works great, no issues
customer_reviews.text: Love this new kindle. It has the things I loved about voyage, plus the physical buttons. I have had no issues with battery life, cover stays securely in place, and the lighting is fine. I never used the adaptive lighting on the voyage, and the recessed screen of the paperwhite was not for me and my tiny hands, so this is best of both worlds. To those griping about the price, think about how much you'd spend buying a cover...it's almost the same price for this as a voyage with a cover. If you can deal with the recessed screen on the paperwhite, then sure, go with that model instead.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby

customer_reviews.title: It maybe a few generations out of date, but it is still amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this device new. I was compelled to grab this gen 1 Oasis because it was priced at 149.00. I like the texture of this Oasis vs the gen 2. The battery lasts for a much longer time than my gen 2. This is of course due to the fact it has the charging cover. That was another really nice bonus. It comes with a nice leather case that also charges the device.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: Great Improvements
customer_reviews.text: I lost my Kindle Voyage on a trip. I LOVED the Voyage. After reading many reviews I decided to try the Oasis for one simple reason: When I read in bed I had a difficult time holding onto and turning pages with the Voyage with one hand. The Oasis solved all that. I love it! It is easy to hold onto with the cover and super light and easy to hold without the cover. The side buttons work great. I love being able to turn the book when I switch hands and having the screen adjust. Who would've though losing my Voyage Kindle would turn out to be a blessing.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Flatt

customer_reviews.title: My device is perfect. I had significant issues with the Voyage and ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased under Prime Now. Shipping was quick (as expected). My device is perfect. I had significant issues with the Voyage and the Paperwhite in terms of evenness and backlighting issues, but none on the Oasis. Mine is white all the way through. Not sure if Amazon fixed the manufacturing in some way, or if I just got lucky. The form factor of the device (n the first 24 hours) is just perfect. I absolutely love it - makes for easier reading on public transit if I have to stand. Because I have to keep it in a cluttered bag, the leather case (which is quite nice) is a must-have. Couldn't be more happy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon User A1

customer_reviews.title: My very Favorite Kindle
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several Kindles and this is the very bast. I love the way my thumb rest on the "turn page button" and the "book" is as light as a feather. The very bast of all is the long time the battery stays charged, it lets me keep the Kindle in my bag so a long time without having to remind myself to take it in the house and pop it back on the charger all the time. LOVE IT, well worth the cost difference!
customer_reviews.author: Rana Goodman

customer_reviews.title: But experience of using it is absolutely amazing - ergonomics of this unit are close to perfection
customer_reviews.text: Too expensive for what it is? True. But experience of using it is absolutely amazing - ergonomics of this unit are close to perfection, and even screen is somehow of slightly higher quality than my wife's Voyager's screen (same tech, better backlighting), and it does not even start to compare with my son's Paperwhite (backlighting on that one is very clearly subpar). Contacts between kindle and its charging cover are getting a bit iffy after some time, but that can be fixed with a tiny bit of DeoxIT and issues goes away.
customer_reviews.author: Olek Poplavsky

customer_reviews.title: A bit disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I am still experiencing problems with this newest edition of Kindle. The selling statement that a "single charge will last months" doesn't apply to me. After a few days of reading several hours per day, I am prompted to recharge a low battery! This is seemingly the same length of charge that I had with my prior 'PaperWhite'. The much higher price added nothing to the length of charge. I am still inadvertently bringing up different screens as I am reading for no apparent reason - perhaps I am just clumsy. I do enjoy reading on the machine rather than a book.
customer_reviews.author: Howard. Bluth

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in Seattle
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing up to now. The screen continues to flicker on me, going back to giving me headers and footers when I do not ask for them. Also the screen can be VERY slow to respond. I do not know what is going on with it but when I have some extra time will try to contact Amazon. This is not something that I would expect from their most expense Kindle.
customer_reviews.author: William J. Long

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice KIndle - and it's my third
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice KIndle - and it's my third. All have been good, but this one has features and improvements that are advanced, and welcomed by me. No five stars though, and that's because the promotions say re-charges are in months. I realize the more you use the device, the more often it has to be charged. I had to re-charge my Paperwhite every ten days or so. I have to re-charge my Oasis about as often. I was hoping for more battery life. Still, I'm glad to have this new device. I wouldn't want to be without a Kindle. John McNeill . Springfield, South Dakota
customer_reviews.author: John A. Mcneill

customer_reviews.title: Battery life not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: If you turn off the back lighting completely and cut off the wifi then the battery might last several weeks but in real life use it is more like a week and a half at best. Certainly not the months advertised by Amazon. Also, I find the backlighting uneven on the side of the screen near the buttons which is annoying. Other than those two items the Oasis is a nice little reader. This device is a step in the right direction but still needs further refinement. Not sure that it is worth the price now being charged.
customer_reviews.author: Virgil Quick

customer_reviews.title: Eh
customer_reviews.text: When i forst got this i loved it but after a little while i just stopped using it having a square display is unique but also very strange and if you dont have it connected to the charging cover the battery can go flat in as little as a day if you read as much as i do with the back light off and the wifi/3g off as well im no longer impressed in any way and "down grading" to the original kindle on the newest generation (10th) with my reading habbits that battery lasts over a month with no wifi usage
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Best Kindle
customer_reviews.text: I really like the Kindle Oasis. Easy to hold, comfortable to read the screen and the long battery is great, especially because I travel quite a bit and in the past often had no battery. The Oasis also looks good! More square and better looking than other Kindles. Finally the screen rotates with the device but the page button function does not - so page up is really page down etc (maybe with the next software update?).
customer_reviews.author: Erwin

customer_reviews.title: Great device but charging cover was a bad design
customer_reviews.text: I had this Kindle Oasis since August 2017 and it was great for just over a year, when the battery charging cover stopped holding a charge. Once this happened the Kindle itself wouldn’t hold a charge for more than an hour or so. I’m glad to see that the next gen kindle oasis no longer relies on a cover for charging but my experience with this kindle makes me think twice on whether to spend $250 on a reading device. I think I’ll either use the iPad Kindle app or buy a regular kindle at this point because I would expect a single purpose device to work well over 18 mos for such a high price tag.
customer_reviews.author: JohnMelinOH

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: I could not be happier! My previous Kindle paperwhite was badly damaged outside of my extend warranty. When I started shopping for a replacement I was going to purchase the same model again since I was so happy with the one that I had. Then I started reading about the oasis model. I wondered if the price was worth it but decided to gamble on an early Christmas present to me. The reader is so tiny and removes from the cover sooo easily! It is easy to hold. Very lightweight. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: LJSMITH

customer_reviews.title: Best e-reader I have seen since well... the e-reader
customer_reviews.text: Amazon hit this one out of the park, best e-reader out there, period ! If you think it is pricey I could understand that, but you get what you pay for, how many readers can you fit in your pants pocket without seeing the power outlet for months ? if you are looking for a moderately priced e-reader there are plenty of options from Amazon or other brands. I would buy another kindle oasis in heartbeat, but given the price tag this is not the Christmas gift for everyone on your list but that doesn't take the merit away from this fantastic piece of technology. Amazon how are you going to improve this one ? it's going to be tough...
customer_reviews.author: LARO

customer_reviews.title: Its Ok
customer_reviews.text: Nice E-Reader but I feel it is over priced. As an avid reader, being disabled, I read at least 6 to 8 hours a day and being old I don't see much difference in the battery life. I have noticed that the corners are really touchy and will change your pages at the slightest press while holding it.
customer_reviews.author: TRHenderson

customer_reviews.title: Fine if you use it for 6 hours or less
customer_reviews.text: Lovely to hold. Nice bright screen. HOWEVER, even in airplane mode and with both Oasis and cover fully charged, it works for fewer than SIX hours before needing recharging. "Months????" Is this a defective device or just misleading promotion?
customer_reviews.author: Linda M

customer_reviews.title: Kindle Oasis E-reader
customer_reviews.text: I'm not satisfied with price and performance of this Oasis E-Reader. For the amount, I expected better readability. For the amount, I expected it to be user friendly. I'm out of luck on both of those. It freezes, ALOT. I'm disappointed with how it is so difficult to just get to a home page. I have trouble reading the pages; there needs to be more selections regarding brightness. I'm just disappointed in general. This is my 3rd Kindle and I am unhappy. The price is WAY too much for such an unfriendly little device. I cannot recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Lee Cusimano

customer_reviews.title: Good, probably not worth the extra money, and  cellular connectivity a scam.
customer_reviews.text: I like this kindle. Its not so much better than a regular one that I can justify spending the extra money. I do like the extended battery life for extra long air flights. One complaint I have is that I opted for the one with cellular connectivity on the expectation I could download a book even when I didn't have reliable wifi. However, any time I've tried to do that, I get a message saying the file is too big and must use wifi. Why sell connectivity access as an option if if doesn't work the specific appliance? It seemed like I was charged for something I didn't actually receive.
customer_reviews.author: Gadgetfan

customer_reviews.title: The Voyage is better and less expensive
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste the money on the Oasis. I was attracted to the longer battery life but the Oasis lasts about the same as my Voyage did. Most of the charge is in the cover so it starts warning you repeatedly as soon as that starts to get low and the charge in the kindle doesn't last more than a couple days once the cover is depleted (during which you have to put up with the annoying cover is low messages). The Voyage also has a great cover that stands the book up in any direction. This is the first time I have ever had buyer's remorse when purchasing an 'upgrade'.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with new Oasis
customer_reviews.text: Having problem with this two week old Oasis. Three times in last week or so the Oasis has locked up with an empty battery symbol after I had been sitting out in sun reading with it for several hours. The Oasis seemed a bit warm but nothing unusual. After putting it in the shade for 30-60 minutes it goes back on and the battery is still fully charged. Never had this problem with older Oasis, otherwise I wouldn't have bought it. Getting ready to return it if I cant get this resolved.
customer_reviews.author: T. Whartenby

customer_reviews.title: the view and the ergonomics are excellent as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I bought it as a gift for my wife three months ago, and she's hardly put it down. I'll take that as a FIVE-STAR rating from her. The battery lasts as advertised; however, it's based upon a reader that goes at it for one half hour per day. Do the math on your own reading habits to figure out how long you will actually read between charges. It's more days rather than months for my wife. Still, it means that if she doesn't plug it in day to day, she still gets to read. As an observer I'd say the light weight, the view and the ergonomics are excellent as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Dexter Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Loved the concept, but Amazon really let me down on this device
customer_reviews.text: When this came out I just had to have it. I was still using my kindle second gen and loved it. I loved the size and the idea of extra battery power in case. Now it doesn’t hold a charge and the case does not charge the device anymore. No other device i have ever purchased from Amazon has ever let me down except this one. Love the concept just wish it was made to last like my previous kindles. If the device had continued to work properly I would not have anything negative at all to say. It really had all the features I wanted
customer_reviews.author: April L. Swisher

customer_reviews.title: Be careful. It died in 1 year.
customer_reviews.text: I’m extremely disappointed with this kindle. It died in one year of casual use. Battery no longer holds th charge and amazon refuses to replace cause it’s out of warranty. The best they did they tried to send me a beat up refurbished one after 2 hours of intense talk. This is a piece of crap save your $300
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Like this Kindle e-reader very much
customer_reviews.text: Like this Kindle e-reader very much. Would however, like the option to highlight passages in different color and also have the option of a dictionary that speaks the word followed by the definition. Lastly, this Kindle does not hold the charge as long as described but I am not troubled by this. On the other hand, because this costs more than any Kindle I have purchased in the past, the USB connection that can be plugged into the wall when your computer isn't available should be included in the purchase price ....not something bought separately.
customer_reviews.author: JILL JANISCH

customer_reviews.title: The battery lift on this unit with the case attached is absolutely amazing..
customer_reviews.text: So this was a little bit smaller than I was expecting, but it's lightweight and thick side bar gives me the ability to read for a longer period of time. The battery lift on this unit with the case attached is absolutely amazing... Very happy with this kindle... Very clear screen to read off of, and i don't have to strain my eyes too much, so again, it allows me to read for long periods of time.
customer_reviews.author: Papasmurfh

customer_reviews.title: High dollar charge - weak battery charge
customer_reviews.text: Nice design but it loses charge very quickly. This is not worth the high cost. I was out of charge after half way through a novel - and yes it was fully charged when I started the book. Called tech support and asked if it was possible to see details percentage of charge. Was told no- just look at the graphic icon. Of course he was wrong. Do not bother to bother to buy unless you like the esthetics. Buy or keep your Voyage. In my case there is no difference in battery life
customer_reviews.author: Kate Juliff

customer_reviews.title: Reading perfected.
customer_reviews.text: I've always been attracted to e-ink readers, starting with the Sony Reader in 2004. I find that if a device has options for more than just reading, like the regular Fires have, I'll end up on Facebook or YouTube instead of reading. The build quality is exceptional, as is the software, miles above even my smartphone (LG V20, which has a tendency to slow down beyond being usable, leading me to turn it off, or shut down apps). The only issue I had with the Oasis was I couldn't get the Merlot leather, as it would have taken a month to be in stock/ship. I would recommend this device to anyone in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Cochran

customer_reviews.title: Expensive gadget, but worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I almost never write reviews, but given some the negative reviews I've seen here, I felt I had to chime in. This kindle is the 8th one I've purchased so I've seen them all. I was very reluctant in ordering the Oasis due to the high cost, but I just couldn't resist due to the smaller size. I have not been disappointed, and find this to be a very slick piece of technology. It really is much smaller/lighter and love the long battery life when attached to the cover. My wife is not a gadget person, but now that she's seen my oasis, she wants one too!
customer_reviews.author: D. Morency

customer_reviews.title: I love the weight and size
customer_reviews.text: I love the weight and size. With my severe arthritis this new reader is just what I need. I am very frustrated though due to the fact that on my previous Paperwhite and my current Voyage most all of the books down loaded the covers of the books. On my new Oasis over half of the books both in my cloud and downloaded no longer have the book cover present. I can find no info on this or how to get the art work.
customer_reviews.author: searching

customer_reviews.title: Nice reader, not so nice battery cover
customer_reviews.text: As a Kindle, it's great. I love the buttons and the way the buttons reverse when you flip it over. The charging cover, OTOH, is a royal pain. Like others I've read about I'm on my second one under warranty and I am STILL getting occasional "your charging cover is disconnected" messages (which are bogus). This second one has never been removed since I got it and yet... it's a shame that something so expensive isn't a bit better debugged.
customer_reviews.author: Old Guy

customer_reviews.title: Just a few changes would make it great
customer_reviews.text: Amazon please: -offer more darker fonts for better contrast (like Helvetica) -add more font sizes with smaller increments -lose the airplane and just make it wi-fi ON, wi-fi OFF -don't waste prime top-of-the-page real estate with "goodreads" and replace it with direct access to the backlighting or font options -offer a cover with a comfortable grip The Oasis is not as ergonomically comfortable as I hoped it would be. The best reader for comfort I had was the first Nook with glow light. It had a wide rubber/silicone bezel with an indented space in the back. It provided a nice comfortable grip with one or both hands.
customer_reviews.author: KibbyRose

customer_reviews.title: Drains more power than something that drains a lot of power...
customer_reviews.text: Two stars for the fact that one topic they brag about so much is a lie. The battery on this thing is worse than all the others I've used. I don't keep wifi on or use the backlight and I get about 2 days out of it and that's with the charging cover attached. They claim it lasts months, Google it, everyone's having problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian W.

customer_reviews.title: A Bit Disappointed ... High Price vis a vis What I Got
customer_reviews.text: While I like the size, the concept and the page buttons, I'm a bit disappointed with the performance. A few too many changes from earlier renditions such as the Paperwhite. No charging light indicator; lousy time of usage (also get a notice that the charging cover is the wrong one ... thrice); no response to emails or queries sent to Amazon. Overall, disappointed with the relatively high price and lack of support. Would recommend another version of Kindle (this is my 7th since the first iteration ... even better planned obsolescence than Apple!).
customer_reviews.author: Evie H

customer_reviews.title: Thin and light weight!
customer_reviews.text: Best e-reader ever and I've had many over the years! Unbelievably light weight! I wondered about the device being asymmetrical but it's less asymmetrical than I was expecting. Not awkward to hold at all. I've had no issues with battery life. I love the page buttons. I have zero complaints. It is more expensive than other paper white type e-readers but if you are an avid reader and can afford it, I don't really think the expense is that big of an issue. Totally worth it in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Oasis thumbs down buy a paperwhite...
customer_reviews.text: iffy screens lighting not even and battery does not deliver as advertised and for 280 you have to pay to eliminate ads? give me a break. I think Amazon at this point should just eliminate this, I think they are in pretty good financial shape...buy the paperwhite better bang for the buck cleaner screen better battery and same resolution on screen...
customer_reviews.author: L. Bubb

customer_reviews.title: Cheap cover literally falls apart with little to no use.
customer_reviews.text: The leather cover is very cheap quality and the corners peel back and fall off after little over a year. Now it's outside of warranty and of course there is nothing they can do. They don't offer a repair service and you cannot order a replacement, so you are basically SOL. So much for purchasing a $300 kindle. The cheaper models held up much better.
customer_reviews.author: Mefunmom

customer_reviews.title: Charging case doesn't work as promised.
customer_reviews.text: 9/2018: Overall, I'm very pleased with the new features, which was my motivation to upgrade when I dropped my Voyage and cracked the screen. However, the merlot leather cover hasn't lasted as well as the origami leather did. My biggest frustration has been the poorly performing secondary battery in the cover. It has never lasted "months", as advertised. It now doesn't hold a full charge more than a day or so. For $300, I certainly expected better performance. This is my third Kindle, having dropped and broken the screen on both the Paperwhite and the Voyage. I had no performance issues with either of those.
customer_reviews.author: duncancritters

customer_reviews.title: Battery Life Not What I Expected...
customer_reviews.text: I like the size and feel of this reader and find it to be everything I expected from Amazon. My only disapointment is the battery life. I expected it to last for a lot longer than it does, in reality. To be honest, the battery life promotion was the biggest reason I bought and paid a big price for this new e-reader. That's why I only gave it four stars out of five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Or Mary Konkel

customer_reviews.title: Readers Delight
customer_reviews.text: What a great product! I am coming up to two years on my Kindle Oasis and I am so impressed with it! I have not had a single problem with the device or any of the many Kindle E books I have read. There is so much available to read at little or no cost. Between Amazon Prime Reading and public library E Books I have many months of reading downloaded to my Kindle. I recommend my Kindle Oasis as a 10 out of 10!
customer_reviews.author: oldupa

customer_reviews.title: WOW! Amazing Kindle!
customer_reviews.text: I have been reading on a Paperwhite for several years, I currently have the second to the latest release. I must say the Oasis just blew me away! It is easy to hold, love the fact that the screen flips for either hand and I love the buttons. It is small and very light, where the Paperwhite with the leather case is not. I have not had any issues with the Oasis what so ever. Price is a little steep, but as a tech gadget freak, I had to have it. I have an iPad Mini 3 for reading anything that I need color capability for books and magazines that require it. Love, love, love it!
customer_reviews.author: Lita Sciturro-Smith

customer_reviews.title: Really love it! The brown leather is kinda distressed and ...
customer_reviews.text: Really love it! The brown leather is kinda distressed and pretty. I like my books to be pretty. :-) Holds a charge pretty well, but if you are a voracious reader like me it could stand to hold it a little longer. I get 2-3 days of solid reading out of it. Maybe 15 hours. I kept my old one for back up and to use outside. I think it's baloney they don't include the charger. This was enough money, it should have an extra or two.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this after I felt my paper white was starting to slow down. I have had the paper white for years and have been happy with it. On average I read 10 books a week. I probably wore my paper white out. I love the Oasis so much more. It is much more comfortable to hold. I love the lightweight cover that holds an extra charge. I love turning the pages with the button instead of the swipe. It downloads books so much faster. Totally worth the money to me. Big improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy.  Cover is useless
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot but probably not more than most. Perhaps 3 hours a day. The claims of battery life are exaggerated and I've never experienced them. PLUS the whole reason for paying 3 times as much was for the charging cover. After as little as 90 minutes I'm told to connect to a battery source. So I connect to my cover which says it has 100% charge. But to often the connection doesn't recognize the Kindle and begin charging. Something with that connection bit on the cover. DO NOT spend this much on a useless and ineffective cover charger.
customer_reviews.author: KOB

customer_reviews.title: Run away
customer_reviews.text: When I first received the item the battery life was not as great as advertised, but mildly tolerable. It quickly worsened, to lasting a few hours. I called amazon and after days of “truble shooting’ they “repaired” my kindle. Again the same pattern started. I call again, just short of the 2 year warranty. Again they strung me along for days with directions to “charge overnight” and call in a few days. Now it has a life of 2-3 hours. They ran the clock out (7/10/19 would be 2 years) and now they are saying “well your warranty is out now!” So hours of my time wasted for a product that never worked like it should. Run away.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Glos

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. It's great for all the obvious reason. The battery is stellar. It's light. It's pretty. I think it's the best thing to read on available, but it's not infallible. Some drawbacks: -e-ink, while aesthetically wonderful, is still crappy technologically. The page refreshes very visibly. -it's slow. Books open slowly. Goodreads runs slowly. -the buttons hurt my fingers. If you're sitting there reading for hours, the edges of the buttons start to hurt. They're squared, not rounded, and it takes a bit of pressure to push them. I end up having to switch to the finger swipe page turning.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: terrible. won't stay charged until the next time i ...
customer_reviews.text: terrible. won't stay charged until the next time i pick it up to read. might only be a day or 2. my paperwhite i hardly ever had to charge. could never get answers or help for this. i don't know if mine is defective or not...i have tried to love it and i hate it. wish i never would have purchased. and i am a kindle freak...have always loved all my kindles. how do you get it to stay charged? worthless at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Kircher

customer_reviews.title: Even better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: It's amazing how well I can read in any lighting with this! I can read at night before sleeping. Then wake up and take it out on the deck in full sun and still have the same great quality viewing screen. IN FULL SUNLIGHT! All without being hard on the eyes! PERFECT! Small enough to fit in my normal sized purse, yet big enough to read a normal page. Battery life if great as well. I don't have to charge but once a week (I read A TON!!!).
customer_reviews.author: ssmithmich

customer_reviews.title: this is a fantastic e-reader. It's very light and has a very ...
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this is a fantastic e-reader. It's very light and has a very nice display. I have had a couple of issues though: 1. One of the page turn buttons is more difficult to press than the other button. The problematic button is nearly flush with the surface of the device. 2. With Wifi enabled, the battery life is only about 5 days with the case. You will want to put the device in airplane mode most of the time. Amazon has offered to replace my device, but there will not be any replacement devices for two more months.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect if not of 2 little inconveniences
customer_reviews.text: I would have given a full 5 if the reader allows me to view my goodreader from my 3G e-reader as it feels kinda of funny that i still have to on my mobile phone's hotspot. Another thing i observed is that my top button (default setting) tends to skip to additional page when i press once. I am not sure is it my reader is too "sensitive" and this happened occasionally during my read. I reset a few times and the occurrences reduced.
customer_reviews.author: Hian Hwee, Lim

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY A KINDLE!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the oasis, thinking I would have it for a while. Turns out, amazon sees these as disposable devices, and doesn't include any form of soft recovery mode. Out of the 2 year warrantee period, your device is on borrowed time. SO! When (not if) the file system becomes corrupted, the device becomes a brick, and there is nothing you can do about it. Amazon support will simply tell you "buy a new kindle!". Yeah, no. Never again. If you must, get a Kobo, or a cheap model kindle. The oasis is never worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Bret

customer_reviews.title: Clearly the best iteration of the Kindle family to date
customer_reviews.text: Clearly the best iteration of the Kindle family to date. Excellent screen resolution, very lightweight, buttons to turn page much less cumbersome than swipe, features rotating screen so changing hands is seamless, and battery life with case battery seems like it will be as good as promised. Would give it five stars, but absurdly abusive pricing prevents top rating. If you can hold out until sanity returns to Amazon price structure, you will be very happy with this newest version.
customer_reviews.author: E A Poe

customer_reviews.title: Bad Idea
customer_reviews.text: I think it was a bad idea to get this one. Although it's very light and ergonomically designed for a better reading experience. I think it is so much overpriced. In adition, I think there is something wrong with my device as the battery depletes very fast that it sometimes stays only two weeks not months as advertised. That is even faster than the Paperwhite. Sometimes I find the Oasis out of charge without using.
customer_reviews.author: Ashraf

customer_reviews.title: Can't charge after 4 months...
customer_reviews.text: We own every single Kindle at home and this one really got me excited when I bought it. However, after using it for 4 months, the Oasis can't be charged and cant start any more. However, I can't return it because it has pass Amazon's one month return period and 2 months support window. I spent $289 and it turns out to be a brick. What a waste of money. Go with Voyage if you can. This one is a nightmare!!! Help, Amazon. I would love to return it!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Koko

customer_reviews.title: BATTERY PROBLEM
customer_reviews.text: This is my second kindle, I bought the previous one 5 year ago. One of the things that motivated me purchasing this kindle, was this: "Longest Kindle battery life--the included leather charging cover can boost battery to months". However, it doesn't last months, not even weeks. I am charging it every 2 or 3 days. I don't know if mine has a problem, but my old kindle lasted much more than this one, I could spend 2 weeks without having to charge it. (I read the same amount of time, and they both were 3g).
customer_reviews.author: Agv

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade for me
customer_reviews.text: I truly, truly enjoy reading again. My last Kindle was like a 2nd generation, and I bought a case with a light on it. It has been great for 5-6 years, but when a co-worker came in with this Kindle Oasis and showed me all the bells and whistles and ESPECIALLY the lighting, oh my goodness, I HAD TO HAVE IT. It fits great in your hand, I enjoy that the screen automatically rotates if you change which hand you're holding it in the words automatically flip right side up. I like that I can still use buttons to change the page (I'm used to that from previous version). To me it was worth the upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Tameko N. Banyard

customer_reviews.title: Not as expected
customer_reviews.text: The biggest disappointment is the battery life. I'm an avid user of the voyage. I've had it for 2 years & I love it. Bought the oasis at a gret cost for 3 reasons: The battery life as promised by amazon to be 'months' with the charging case; the enhanced touchscreen & the enhanced built in front light. The oasis does not deliver the battery life promised, even after a replacement from amazon, I thought the first one was faulty. However, it delivers nicely on the 2 other points that I was looking for. I wish the battery life was as good as advertised, it would have been a solid 5 stars despite the hefty price.
customer_reviews.author: Shnobz

customer_reviews.title: I like how light weight and compact it is
customer_reviews.text: I like how light weight and compact it is. I can also read it in bright sunlight without any glare. Not having to recharge it everyday is a real bonus. The downside is it will not download books from my public library via the internet like my old kindle would. I have to use my computer to send books to my Oasis. This is very inconvenient and frustrating. For me, my old kindle was more user friendly. I am more or less in a love-hate relationship with the Oasis.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria

customer_reviews.title: Oasis is a must if you are a book lover...
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love the Oasis. The last kindle I had was the Paperwhite 1st Gen. This is definitely an upgrade. I am a book lover, I read in multiple languages and multiple books at once. Its very light and small, my current phone looks bigger. I enjoy the turn page buttons and the touch screen is a lot more intuitive and responds faster.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: The Oasis is the best one so far for the most part
customer_reviews.text: I have been a Kindle owner from day one. I had a release day Kindle. The Oasis is the best one so far for the most part. It is responsive and easy to use. The screen is crisp and easy to read. My perception is that the battery life is less than my paper white. Also, the battery cover is not as secure as I would like. It slips off occasionally. Is it worth the money when compared to the paper white? Not really. Is it a nice device? Yes. I don't regret the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Expensive and no audible support
customer_reviews.text: I love the form factor and like the battery life, even though it is overstated - not months, not even weeks, but a few days. Biggest beef is no audible support - Really? you own audible and you can Get an audio version of most books when I buy them on kindle, but no support on your own device. For the cost which is significant it should have audio support in general.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Werner

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a gift for an avid reader. I was a little nervous about it because he is very "traditional" and prefers actual books over e-readers....but he LOVES it! He takes it with him everywhere. The backlight is not too bright to hurt your eyes and the touch screen is intuitive and simple. The sleek design makes it easy to carry with you. The library of books available is endless. This was a perfect gift for my avid reader.
customer_reviews.author: mama of 3

customer_reviews.title: I like everything about the Oasis except the battery life
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about the Oasis except the battery life. I wind up charging the case and Oasis about every two weeks that's about how long it takes for the low battery alert to pop up. I get more than double that life on my Voyage. I never use WiFi on either and only use the 3G to download books. Will probably use the Voyage for the bulk of my reading. 2/11/2017. Now the darn thing is way slow connecting to the 3G? Now I can't buy and download a book without waiting forever. I've tried rebooting and all the normal fixes. Don't know if this started after the latest update? Gurrrrr!!!
customer_reviews.author: Vern J. Gustason

customer_reviews.title: A joy to use
customer_reviews.text: Very nice and a convenient size. It will just barely fit in my pants pocket. Like most other reviews I find that the ads are not intrusive at all and are just there when you wake the device up. Not worth paying to turn them off and they can be helpful. I like the physical buttons and the ability to rotate the device so the buttons are easily access whether you are holding it in your left or right hand. I find myself switch hands from time-to-time. The device does seem over-priced but I wanted the small size and light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love it. Amazon has rea
customer_reviews.text: I received the kindle oasis as a birthday gift from my daughter. I absolutely love it. Amazon has rea!ly hit a home run with this reader. I have the paperwhjte but this new oasis is even better. I have disabilities and im losing strenght in my hands. My favorite passion is to read. The weight of this new kindle oasis i can't even tell I'm holding it and the page turn is right there under my thumb so i don't have to move and lose my holding position. With osteoarthritis and fibromyalgia the little things like the weight of a book is the difference whether i can continue reading. Thank yoh amazon and thank you Judy Smith.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly McGowen

customer_reviews.title: Nice but no cigar!
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves it. I was going to get one, too, but after using hers for a short time, it just seemed to small. I found myself turning pages too often and I did not want to reduce size of print. I did like the clarity of the print and how light this kindle is even in the charge case, but it does not appear worth the $300 to me, no matter the value of the case. I have a hard time justifying the high cost of new books, let alone the high cost of new Kindles. My bet is we will see changes in the Oasis model soon.
customer_reviews.author: Larry L. Bartle

customer_reviews.title: Great product for professionals!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a Chef/Dietician gave it 5 stars due to it being a amazing tool for recipe cooking! Amazon did fix the "Good Reads" logging issues it had. I like that it has a nice leather case with charger included. The light including put the piece of cake on a great product. It came already programmed with my prime information. I also like the security features included with it so you can put your own PIN to lock the device in case it's stolen.
customer_reviews.author: Mattadamsdietmanager

customer_reviews.title: Stop with the bickering on price...
customer_reviews.text: Easily the most beautiful reader on the market, and one I will own and enjoy for years to come. Don't want to pay this much for it? Choose one of the SEVERAL other options at lower price points, not to mention thousands of used units out there. Can't understand the hate for an item clearly priced at a premium for premium qualities. Are they necessary for a good reading experience? No. No kindle is- go pick up a book, and stop hating for something that isn't meant for you.
customer_reviews.author: M.W.

customer_reviews.title: Better use for your money
customer_reviews.text: This is an overpriced piece of crap! I had to charge it more often than my 5 year old paperwhite! Not impressed one bit.
customer_reviews.author: Jodie 2

customer_reviews.title: Finaly Kidle did it!
customer_reviews.text: this is the most comfortable holding Kindle ever! Now there is no accidental screen touch problem! The reson I put 3 stars because of the price and the problem with the cover battery that would not connect well, and the problem of missing some letters with PDF scanned books (Arabic Books). Other than that is a great device! Actually I was waiting from kindle to solve this "accidental touch" and they did with confident rubber battens! .... and if you want to switch holding the device (ex: from your right hand to the left) the page would flip to mach the direction of your reading.
customer_reviews.author: Nasser Alhameli

customer_reviews.title: OH HUM
customer_reviews.text: I have the same problems with the replacement as with the first. It freezes and needs to be turned off in order to get it to work properly again. I thought the problem would subside with time but it has not. There are many things I like about the Oasis but sometimes it is frustrating. The size and the clarity are wonderful but I don't find the battery to be that much better than my Paper White. I guess I'm disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Irene

customer_reviews.title: Love the new Kindle
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be happier with my new Kindle Oasis. I really like the improvements they made over the previous model. Page turning is much easier and I like the idea of the charging cover because you can go weeks without having to recharge it, making it great to take to the beach or on camping trips or where you don't have electricity to recharge. I have had almost every Kindle that's come out and I really think this is the best one. Easy to read in the bright light or with the automatic light setting at night. Adjusting the fonts and the sizes and the space in between lines is really nice as well.
customer_reviews.author: KPHawaii

customer_reviews.title: Overall...worth the purchase price except for the constant charging
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted this Kindle and waited over a year to get it. I like it...it does what is says...it feels good in my hands and I love the charging cover. The real big issue that I have is that it needs to be charged often. I'll be reading and check and I need to put it on the charging cover...I can't believe how often I have to put it on the charging cover. I think that's my only issue. Otherwise...it's what it's said to be.
customer_reviews.author: PantherGurlene

customer_reviews.title: Nice Oasis, C$arge A Lot but The Book Charge Don't Last Even If the Cover Charge is Loaded!
customer_reviews.text: One problem is that the Kindle Cover battery is charged but if you have been reading for several hours the Oasis book keeps flashing that you need to charge the book. Last time I had read for 7 hours and there was little charge to the book but 75% charge to the cover but I could not keep reading due to the flashing window that stated I was soon to have my Oaisis shut-off and needed to recharge the book! This blows the advantage rght out of the water. Why can't the cover keep charging the book? Can this be fixed?
customer_reviews.author: Bernard Hudson MD

customer_reviews.title: Best kindle I've ever owned (and I've owned almost all of them)
customer_reviews.text: I was honestly planning on returning this. I bought it purely out of curiosity. Once I held it, I immediately fell in love. This is unlike any other kindle. I've owned all the cheaper versions, and this is leaps and bounds better. It's SO MUCH easier to hold with one hand. The battery is great. There is even lighting throughout. The touch response time is much faster. It's so good that I ended up buying another one for my girlfriend too. Good job, Amazon. I'm impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse j

customer_reviews.title: Good but hoped for better.
customer_reviews.text: It is very light weight with the cover off which is great, however, the charge goes down really fast when you read without it. I could not make it through one book without having to recharge. With cover on you can go through two books before charging. Reading time is not as long as advertising makes it sound. My touch Kindle stopped being able to download books through Amazon but I had no problem downloading library books. In researching this problem online, other people had the same problem of it locking up and getting error messages. Maybe Kindles are only supposed to last about four years so you have to buy new ones.
customer_reviews.author: amber35

customer_reviews.title: Extremely poor battery life
customer_reviews.text: I found the Oasis disappointing. Some small features ceased working within a few months. Not a huge deal as the reader still functioned fine for reading. But! The battery life was horrid from the start. It never lasted as long as was described. And drained quickly for no apparent reason. And now one and a half years old it is completely dead. Won’t charge. I really don’t think I will buy another. Too expensive for very questionable life span.
customer_reviews.author: aldis

customer_reviews.title: Bought another
customer_reviews.text: Hands down this is my favorite Oasis. I have the current larger size Oasis, but this one I love more. The small size fits perfectly in my hand, and does not have that cold aluminum back. Amazon doesn’t make this one anymore, but there are sellers on eBay who have brand new ones. I have purchased a couple to keep in reserve, and the ones I have purchased also have the 3G feature. I love all the Kindles, but this one is the winner for me!
customer_reviews.author: PAgyrl

customer_reviews.title: Battery blew up- could have had a house fire. What the hell?
customer_reviews.text: Seriously.. the lithium battery blew up like a balloon and could have started a house fire. What the hell? I bought a new Oasis and am now concerned about my new one too. ************** How long is this kindle supposed to last? I bought it in May of 2017 and the battery is completely shot. I plug it in and it doesnt charge. I tried switching cords in case that was the issue. This was 300 bucks and expected it to last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Ravenesque82

customer_reviews.title: Love my new Oasis
customer_reviews.text: Love my new Oasis. So much easier to hold than my old Kindle Keyboard. Small enough to fit in most purses. I have no issues at all with the LEDs showing ghosting - have perfect lighting. Yes, it was a bit expensive but I took advantage of the payment plan with no interest which made the purchase basically painless. Love having both the page change buttons and the touch screen. Figured since I was used to the buttons, I would be using them instead of the touchscreen but not true - switch back and forth depending on situations at hand.
customer_reviews.author: DONNA COOPER

customer_reviews.title: Excellent ereader
customer_reviews.text: Amazon does it again. This is for serious readers. Yes, the battery may not last as long as what Amazon says, but as the saying goes, mileage may vary. Most people don't read for 24 hours straight. So you have to charge it more often, not a deal breaker. My last ereader was a Paperwhite, so this was a nice upgrade. I'm a serious eBook reader. The lighting and weight are so much better than previous generations.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Clingman

customer_reviews.title: Big improvement over Paper white.
customer_reviews.text: I would have given 5 stars but for fact cover not connecting properly. At least that was the error message (even though cover was charging correctly). Contacted tech support who did complete re-post. That seemed to solve problem, but after week or so got same old error message. Have requested new cover. Also found the experimental browser to be hyper sensitive to touch when, for example, trying to access my local library to borrow books for Kindle. Otherwise, this is a great reader... Lightweight, easy to hold, easy to turn pages, and great in any lighting. Use often at beach in bright sun without any problem.
customer_reviews.author: ALLYAN W. RIVERA

customer_reviews.title: Shorter than expected battery life
customer_reviews.text: This Kindle is really light and compact, so I really like to read with it. The problem with it is that it doesn't last as long on a charge as I had anticipated. I've had it a little over two months and have had to re-charge it 3 times. It lasts about 3 books on a charge and doesn't last anywhere near as long as the months promised by Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Cole
